channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fire risky because accumulation of trash, 12th September
item.description:
Someone is sleeping there and leaving a lot of trash around, and accumulating garbage and waste around. It could become a problem for pet control and potential fires.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brunswick Quay, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are broken pavements outside of beacon high school Hilldrop Rd, London N7 0JG, 12th September
item.description:
This needs to immediately fixed to ensure public and environmental health and safety. This is outside a primary school so needs to be fixed immediately to ensure the children who attend this school I safe.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hilldrop Road, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting out for 12 months, 12th September
item.description:
Both the street lights on Puddle Dock haven't worked for 12 months There are two sharp corners in the cycle lane - which makes street lighting even more important Please finally get this fixed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Puddle Dock, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Front door glass broken and door is stiff, 12th September
item.description:
The entrance to the block for houses 41-48 has broken glass and the door is extremely stiff when pulling to open. Often the bell has to be rung twice for the door to open and still extreme force is needed for it to pry.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33-48, Lympstone Gardens, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household wate/ broken glass, 12th September
item.description:
Dumped sofa and food all over the side entrance to the primary school. Broken glass all over the pavements. There was a huge Rat within the rubbish. This is a regular occurrence.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lime Kiln Drive, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verge, wooden vehicle restricters missing, 12th September
item.description:
Three upright vehicle restriction bollards are missing from the verge. This has been reported on many occasions. Vehicles are parking on the verge, causing damage to utility service covers, flooding and safety issues. The safety issue is the large delivery vehicles block the road sight when pulling out of the parking directly beyond the verge. Attached is a photo of the damaged verge and a photo of what the missing wooden bollards.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Falloden Way, Temple Fortune, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Winn Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Office and Dining Chairs Dumped Again on Wheathill Road, 12th September
item.description:
Two more chairs — one office and one wooden dining chair — have been dumped on the pavement at the corner of Wheathill Road. This is now a near-daily occurrence, and it’s clear flytippers see this spot as a free-for-all. Residents deserve better than to live in a dumping ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wheathill Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oh look someone's lost their number plates again. Maybe Hackney Council can find out why this is happening on a regular basis so many number plates are being discarded in bushes,down Hackney Council drain covers, draining system ., 12th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London

item.title: Outside house Capo di Monte, Windmill Hill NW3 6RJ, 12th September
item.description:
I reported 8 July, Fixmystreet ref: 7828483 (you incorrectly recorded address "outside judges walk house") and 9 September, Fixmystreet ref: 8140844. "Residents are planting bushes blocking the footpath ... and state that they have an agreement with Camden to do this." On 2 Sep Camden emailed me "investigated and fixed". On 9 Sep Camden answered "if it's in the tree pit it's allowed". It's NOT in the tree pit, but all over 20 metres of the footpath including 20 or so 2 metre bushes. Nothing has changed and the footpath is still impassable. Please tell me if the residents have an an agreement with Camden to do this. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Windmill Hill, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Doubles door fridge is still blocking the pavement on Cator street, 12th September
item.description:
This fridge has now been there for two weeks, could this please be removed, despite submitting an earlier fix my street request nothing has been done about it. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Surrey Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
